source_sentence: 法華三昧行事運想補助儀
translation: Supplemental Ritual for the Conduct of the Lotus Samādhi
By Zhanran, a Qing ascetic of the Tang
"Although the rituals and repentance teachings have the same effect in the world, many of their activities, rituals, and conceptualizations don't go hand in hand.
Many of their activities, rituals, and concepts aren't well rounded.
Sometimes a person's crude reading of a confessional text isn't helpful.
Some people reject the principle of contemplation before they exert themselves.
They lack the style of effective effort.
They lack the readiness to enter the gate.

source_sentence: 故言勤修苦行非涅槃因。
translation: That's why they say diligently cultivating austerities isn't a cause of nirvāṇa.
But the text of the ritual for worship and recollection isn't inappropriate.
It's because the activity of perceptions that are heavy with distracting emotions is difficult to accomplish.
I have further elaborated on this topic in response to Tiantai.

source_sentence: 撮覽樞總使隨言作念隨念成想。
translation: It's a summary of the general overview of the pivot so that mindfulness is created according to language and conceptions are formed according to thought.
He should examine each one as if it were his present.
Let's make sure that each moment isn't in vain and that things and principles are accomplished.
This article summarizes the ten dharmas.
It summarizes the essential things and principles.

source_sentence: 初嚴淨道場(如無別屋亦可同間絕無己物方可外求)。
translation: First, he purifies the site of enlightenment (if there's no separate house, he can share the same dwelling and have nothing of his own before seeking it externally).

source_sentence: 二淨身(新衣舊衣新染並得。
translation: Second, it purifies the body (new clothes, old clothes, and new and dyed clothes are both obtained.)
If he doesn't have these two garments, he'll be better off with the old).

source_sentence: 三三業供養(若總禮三寶。
translation: Three samādhi offerings (If you worship the three treasures in general, you may want to follow them one by one.
It's not necessary to think of each one individually and in accordance with the direction.
He simply contemplates himself and the buddhas of the ten directions.
The reality, characteristics, and principle are originally devoid of subject and object.
There's no perception of what can be worshipped and what's worshipped.
This absence of subject and object is called the ocean of the Dharma realm.
May all sentient beings see this principle together.
This is called entering together.")

source_sentence: 次運香(唱至受用作佛事竟。
translation: Next, he carries the incense (after singing until he's finished accepting the use of the Buddha's name as a service.
The next thought that arises is not arising from this mind.
It can carry it to the ten directions.
That's why it's called "one thought.
He thinks.
'May this fragrant flower pervade the ten directions.
Let it be a platform of subtle radiance.
The music of the gods and the precious fragrance of the gods.
The food of the gods and the precious clothing of the gods.
Inconceivably marvelous dust of dharmas.
From each particle comes all the dust.
From each particle comes all dharmas.
They whirl around without hindrance, adorn each other, and carry on.
They reach all the Three Treasures.
In front of the three treasures of the ten worlds, there's my body cultivated and offered.
They all have our bodies to cultivate and make offerings to.
Each one of them completely pervades the Dharma realm.
Each is unadulterated, unobstructed, and mutually adorned.

source_sentence: 盡未來際作佛事普熏法界。
translation: As far back as the future, they'll perform Buddha-works that will universally perfume the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 諸眾生蒙熏皆發菩提心。
translation: All sentient beings who are perfumed will arouse the mind of enlightenment.
They'll all enter nonproduction and realize Buddha's wisdom.")
He asked the Buddha (My three karmic natures are like space.
Śākyamuni is likewise.
He doesn't give rise to the true state for the sake of sentient beings.
I'll come with all of them and accept offerings.'')

source_sentence: 次請佛菩薩(但改牟尼及形相來處)。
translation: Next, he invites the buddhas and bodhisattvas (only to change the name of the Muni and where he comes in form).
Fifth, he praises the Buddha (before the verse, he conceptualizes each one separately.
He's standing in front of the three treasures in his own body.
Next, he mouths the verse and follows the sound with the thought.
'My body and mind are originally without arising or ceasing.'
Therefore, even though I praise him, he's like a shadow or a sound.")
Six Prostrations to the Buddha (When he sings this verse, he focuses on single-mindedness.
First, he pays homage with utmost respect.
He's single-minded in deed.
Next, he conceives of the subject and object as being the principle of oneness of mind.
He should conceptualize and say.
'The nature of what's worshipped and that which's worshipped is empty and quiescent.'
It's difficult to fathom the path of response.
'This place of enlightenment of mine is like the pearl of Indra.
The Śākyamuni's shadow appears within it.
The shadow of my body appears in front of the Tathāgata.
I bow with my head and feet in homage to the Tathāgata.")

source_sentence: 多寶佛(多寶如來影現中。
translation: Prabhūtaratna (In the shadow of the Prabhūtaratna Tathāgata, my body's reflection appears in front of the Tathāgata.
My reflection is shown in front of Prabhūtaratna.
The rest are the same as the above thought).

source_sentence: 分身(分身諸佛亦同上想。
translation: (The part-bodies of the buddhas are also conceived as above.
) Eastern buddhas (In the images of the Eastern buddhas, I'm reflected in front of them.
I'm a reflection of all the buddhas in front of them.
This goes up to the level of each of the ten directions.)

source_sentence: 三世諸佛(乃至過現未來並同上想)。
translation: The buddhas of the three times (even past, present, and future are conceived in the same way as the above).

source_sentence: 舍利形像等(諸佛法身如虛空。
translation: The images of Śāriputra and so forth (The Dharma bodies of the buddhas are like space.
It's difficult to fathom the transformation phenomena that will abide in the world.
I've been shown all of them before they were transformed.
Each one of them is worshipped with respect and reverence.")
Marvelous Dharma (The vacuum of the Dharma realm is like empty space.
It's difficult to fathom the eternally abiding Dharma treasure.
I've all been shown the Dharma treasure.
None of them are not all given homage).

source_sentence: 諸菩薩(彼一一菩薩影現中。
translation: Bodhisattvas (In the shadow of each of these bodhisattvas, there's also this below).

source_sentence: 乃至下方亦如是)舍利弗等(先想聲聞皆是本來諸佛。
translation: Even down below is likewise.) Śāriputra and the others (First, we thought that the śrāvakas were all originally buddhas.
They're now called śrāvakas because they're being taught from the beginning.")

source_sentence: 普賢菩薩(為滅障故接足禮餘同上)。
translation: Samantabhadra Bodhisattva (prostrating with his feet for the sake of removing hindrances. The rest are the same as the above).

source_sentence: 普為(我及眾生無始常為三業六根重罪所障。
translation: They universally acknowledged that (beginninglessly, we and sentient beings have always been hindered by the three activities and heavy sins of the six faculties.
We don't see the buddhas.
We don't know the essentials of escape.
We only follow birth and death and don't know the marvelous principle.

source_sentence: 我今雖知猶與一切眾生同為一切重罪所障。
translation: Even though I know it now, I'm still hindered by all the heavy sins along with all sentient beings.
Now, I'd like to face the buddhas of the ten directions of Samantabhadra.
I'd like to take refuge in the lives of all sentient beings and repent.
May they be protected and the hindrances extinguished.")

source_sentence: 七懺悔應運逆順十心云(我與眾生無始來。
translation: The seven repentances should be carried out against the ten subordinate states of mind (I and sentient beings have been here since beginningless time.
Now, it's because of our mistaken views.

source_sentence: 內計我人外加惡友不隨喜他一毫之善。
translation: I've imagined myself as a person plus bad friends and haven't liked a single bit of goodness from others.
They only pervade the three activities and commit numerous sins.
Although these things aren't extensive, bad thoughts pervade them.
They continue day and night without interruption.
He conceals his faults and doesn't want people to know about them.
They aren't afraid of the evil path, and they lack conscience and modesty.
They deny the absence of cause and effect.

source_sentence: 故於今日對十方佛普賢大師。
translation: Therefore, today, I'm facing the buddhas of the ten directions, the great teacher Samantabhadra.
He has deep faith in the law of cause and effect and has arisen from a deep sense of shame.
He gives rise to great fear.
He arouses the mind of repentance and stops continuity.
He gives rise to the mind of enlightenment, stops bad qualities, and cultivates goodness.
He diligently encourages the three karmic activities to reverse the grave errors of the past.
He takes delight in even the slightest bit of goodness of worldlings and sages.
He's mindful that the buddhas of the ten directions have great merit and wisdom.

source_sentence: 能救拔我及諸眾生從二死海置三德岸。
translation: They can rescue me and other sentient beings from the ocean of two deaths and set us on the shore of three virtues.

source_sentence: 從無始來不知諸法本性空寂。
translation: From time immemorial, we didn't know that the nature of all things was empty and quiescent.
We've created a multitude of evils.
Now, we know emptiness and quiescence in order to pursue bodhi.
It's for the sake of sentient beings that he cultivates goodness and extinguishes all evil.
He cultivates goodness and extensively ends all kinds of evil.
May Samantabhadra have mercy and accept it.")

source_sentence: 次懺六根(至文並須略知。
translation: Next, he repents of the six faculties (up to the text and should be briefly understood.

source_sentence: 文相含於逆順十種心相縱有闕略。
translation: The text contains ten negative and negative aspects of mind, even though they are omitted.

source_sentence: 在四悔中於菩提中見不清淨等。
translation: Among the four kinds of repentance, seeing what's in bodhi is unclear and pure.
This is a person who mistakenly conceives of himself.
Vairocana is observing the emptiness of the nature of sin.
The world-honored one is mindful of the buddhas of the ten directions.
In the last four kinds of repentance, there's the mind that arouses joy.
This is the cause and condition that makes it ultimately pure.

source_sentence: 是斷相續心歸向普賢及一切世尊。
translation: This is the mind that ends continuity and returns to Samantabhadra and all the world-honored ones.
This is the cause for sentient beings to give rise to the mind of enlightenment.
Each repentance is composed of three actions.
It's cultivating merit, making up for faults, and so forth.
It's disclosing a fault.
It's falling into a bad destiny and becoming terrified.'
It's fearing a bad destiny and developing a sense of shame.
It's believing in the results of causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 凡宣悔詞須加事想破於愛心。
translation: Whenever he declares repentance, he must add the idea of things that break through craving.

source_sentence: 至觀罪性空總想事理悔於見心。
translation: When he observes the emptiness of the nature of sins, he'll generally conceive of phenomena and principles and repent of his views.
If he wants to further abbreviate the three faculties of vision, ears, and nose, he can sometimes use them.
They may also be used at times.

source_sentence: 若舌身意三根是業故不得。
translation: If the tongue, body, and mind faculties are karmic, then they can't be omitted.
The first three faculties are omitted, even if they're omitted.
It's necessary to make sure they aren't lost.
By going along with the ten great intentions of the mind, he'll attain them.")

source_sentence: 勸請(十方諸佛以道眼力故知我見我。
translation: Encouragement (The buddhas of the ten directions know and see me because of the power of the eye of the Way.
I urge the buddhas to do so.
Please let them stay a long time and turn the right wheel of the Dharma.
Where they're born, they'll always be able to encourage them.'')

source_sentence: 隨喜(十方凡聖一毫之善。
translation: Delight in (The least bit of goodness from worldlings in the ten directions.
I will delight in them all.
Their merits cause those who see them to rejoice.
Therefore, I rejoice.")

source_sentence: 迴向(無始來時乃至今日盡未來際一毫之善。
translation: Returning the favor (Every single bit of goodness from beginningless time until the end of the future today.
He repents and encourages [others] to follow suit.

source_sentence: 皆同法界與諸眾生共成佛道)。
translation: They're all the same as the Dharma realm and the sentient beings who share the Buddha Way.")

source_sentence: 發願(大體須存滅罪除障開顯法門滿四弘誓。
translation: He gives rise to the vow (the essence of which is to preserve the four vast vows of extinguishing sins and removing hindrances and opening up the Dharma gate.
The rest must be in accordance with bodhi.")

source_sentence: 行道(欲行時更須正立想。
translation: Practice the path (When you want to practice, you must also correctly establish the concept.
'This site of enlightenment is like the Dharma realm.
The three treasures of the ten directions are clothed in space.

source_sentence: 以次回身旋遶法座想十方三寶心性寂滅。
translation: He then turns around and circles the Dharma seat, imagining that the nature of the three treasures in the ten directions is tranquil.
Their images appear in ten directions, and the sūtras sound like echoes.
(The mind's perception is like a dream, and so is the sound of Brahmā.)

source_sentence: 三歸(一一各想三處三寶與頂禮俱運。
translation: The three refuges (one by one, he thinks of the three treasures in each of the three places and pays homage to them both.
Although the first text directly refers to the ten directions, the meaning is also in all three places.
The idea is that they're also in the three places.

source_sentence: 若從懺悔已下凡云禮三寶者。
translation: If someone pays homage to the Three Treasures from the time of repentance on down, they must each give rise to a separate conception of the Three Treasures.
Each one of them must give rise to three separate conceptions.
He bows his head three times to the ground.
"One, the Three Treasures of the ten directions.
Two, all three treasures in the Lotus Sutra.
Three: "The great teacher Samantabhadra.
He should seek repentance at these three places.

source_sentence: 又凡散華皆於言前散華之時。
translation: Whenever he scatters flowers, he says, "When I scatter flowers,
"After he conceives of the Three Treasures and thinks of Samantabhadra, he then proclaims these words of repentance.
Next, he proclaims words of repentance.
Later, in the text, it says.

source_sentence: 散華等者心指前所散之華。
translation: "When he scatters flowers, his mind refers to the flowers he scattered earlier.
"If someone burns incense, they should send a censer to the Dharma seat.
You should also think of the body and send it to each censer.

source_sentence: 遍至十方一一法華經前乃至普熏一切三寶。
translation: It should reach each one in the ten directions in front of the Lotus Sutra and even universally perfume all the Three Treasures.
If he burns a hand censer, he simply adds incense to it first.
After holding the censer next, he gives rise to a thought according to the situation.
Then he'll proclaim the words or phrases orally.")
The text for sitting meditation is abbreviated.
It should be like Zhiguan's ten dharmas that make up the vehicle and so forth.
He performs the ritual of reciting the Lotus Sutra at dusk and at five o'clock.
When the time is short, this is an abbreviated version.

source_sentence: 我(某甲)及法界眾生從無始世來。
translation: "Since beginningless time, I (someone) and all sentient beings in the Dharma realm have been hindered by nescience, confused, and lost.
We've been hindered by nescience, confused, and lost.

source_sentence: 而由六根三業不善廣造十惡四重五逆。
translation: As a result of the six faculties and three unwholesome activities, we've created 10 evils, four grave crimes, and five heinous crimes.
There are even ten grave and forty-eight lesser offenses.
They are countless and limitless, and it's impossible to explain them in detail.

source_sentence: 十方諸佛常在世間法音不絕。
translation: The buddhas of the ten directions are always present in the world, and the sound of the Dharma never stops.
Their sublime fragrance fills the air with the taste of the Dharma.
They emit pure light that illuminates and contacts everything.
The eternally abiding marvelous principle pervades space.

source_sentence: 我無始來六根內盲三業昏暗。
translation: Since beginningless time, I've been blinded by the six internal faculties and dimmed by the three karmas.
I don't see, don't hear, and don't perceive or understand them.
Because of these causes and conditions, I've long been born into saṃsāra.
I've gone through a hundred thousand million eons in a bad destiny.
There's never a time of escape.
The sūtras say.

source_sentence: 釋迦如來名毘盧遮那遍一切處。
translation: "The Śākyamuni tathāgata is called Vairocana, which pervades all places.
Therefore, you should know this.
'All dharmas are nothing but Buddha dharmas.'
But I don't understand and follow the current of ignorance.

source_sentence: 是則於菩提中見不清淨。
translation: This is because I don't see purity in enlightenment.
In liberation, fetters are created.
Now is the time to awaken and now is the time to repent.
It gives rise to great shame and great fear.
He recites and upholds the three great vehicle offerings.

source_sentence: 歸向普賢菩薩及一切世尊。
translation: He returns to Samantabhadra Bodhisattva and all the world-honored ones.
He burns incense and spreads flowers to reveal his repentance.
The six faculties and three activities that he's created will be permanently stopped.
Continuously, they won't be created again.

source_sentence: 以是因緣今我與法界眾生三業六根無始所作。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, I and sentient beings in the Dharma realm now have three actions and six faculties that we've done since beginningless time.

source_sentence: 現作當作自作教他見聞隨喜。
translation: We will now create them as our own, teach others to see and hear them, and then rejoice in them.
Whether they remember or don't remember, whether they're conscious or not, whether they're aware or not aware.
Whether it's doubtful or not, whether it's covered or revealed.

source_sentence: 畢竟清淨(懺悔已歸命禮三寶)。
translation: It's ultimately pure. (After confessing, he returns to the Three Treasures with his life as his salutation.)

source_sentence: 法華三昧行事運想補助儀
translation: Supportive Ritual for the Performance of the Activities of Lotus Absorption and Conceptualization
